snippet: Stories like Donal Ryan’s hearten struggling writers and remind us that there is no science to evaluating literary work.
abstract: Editorial observes author Donal Ryan received 47 rejections for his first book, and now his novel The Spinning Heart has made the cut for Man Booker Prize long list; contends Ryan's story gives hope to struggling writers, and is reminder that a healthy book industry is a diverse one; laments that book industry, with its upcoming mergers, is moving in opposite direction.
lead_paragraph: Stories like Donal Ryan’s hearten struggling writers and remind us that there is no science to evaluating literary work.

headline.main: 47 Rejections, Then the Booker Long List
headline.print_headline: 47 Rejections, Then the Booker Long List
